reason: RetryHandler is used in batch applications to automatically retry recoverable errors like database deadlocks. Module dependency is nablarch-fw-standalone which is batch-related.
DuplicateProcessCheckHandler prevents concurrent execution of the same batch process. Module dependency is nablarch-fw-batch. Explicitly for batch applications.

RequestThreadLoopHandler repeatedly executes subsequent handlers until a process stop request occurs. Used for processes that monitor message queues or database tables (resident batch). Module: nablarch-fw-standalone.

ProcessStopHandler controls process termination for loop handlers (ProcessResidentHandler, LoopHandler, RequestThreadLoopHandler). Used in batch applications. Module dependencies: nablarch-fw-standalone and nablarch-fw-batch.
DataReadHandler sequentially reads input data using DataReader. Used in batch applications for processing large datasets. Module: nablarch-fw-standalone.
MultiThreadExecutionHandler creates sub-threads to execute subsequent handlers in parallel. Primarily used in batch applications for performance improvement. Module: nablarch-fw-standalone.

StatusCodeConvertHandler converts status codes from subsequent handler results to process exit codes. Used in standalone/batch applications. Module: nablarch-fw-standalone. Must be placed immediately after Main handler.
Main is the entry point launcher for standalone applications (batch). Initializes system repository and executes handler queue. Module: nablarch-fw-standalone.

DbConnectionManagementHandler manages database connections on threads for subsequent handlers and libraries. Used across all application types (batch and REST). Must be paired with TransactionManagementHandler.
GlobalErrorHandler catches uncaught exceptions and errors from subsequent handlers, performs logging, and returns results. Common handler used across all application types. Module: nablarch-fw.
ThreadContextHandler initializes thread context attributes (request ID, user ID, language, etc.) for each request. Common handler used across all application types including batch and REST.
ThreadContextClearHandler removes thread local variables set by ThreadContextHandler. Common handler used across all application types. Must be placed as far forward as possible in the handler queue.

TransactionManagementHandler provides transparent transaction control for resources like databases and message queues. Common handler used across all application types. Must be placed after DbConnectionManagementHandler.

FileRecordWriterDisposeHandler closes output files opened by business actions or handlers using FileRecordWriterHolder. Primarily used in batch applications that output files. Module: nablarch-core-dataformat.

RequestPathJavaPackageMapping dispatches to actions based on request path. Mainly used in messaging functionality to dispatch to arbitrary actions. In batch context, used with Main launcher's -requestPath option. Module: nablarch-fw.

PermissionCheckHandler checks if the logged-in user has permission for the current request (request ID). Used in web/REST applications for authorization. Module: nablarch-common-auth. References InternalRequestIdAttribute and forwarding_handler which are web-related.

RequestHandlerEntry calls delegate handlers only for specific request paths. Main use case is with ResourceMapping for static content downloads in web applications. Can also be used to change database connections for specific URLs. Module: nablarch-core.

ServiceAvailabilityCheckHandler checks service availability for requests. Throws ServiceUnavailable (503) if service is unavailable. Used in web/REST applications. References InternalRequestIdAttribute and forwarding_handler which are web-related. Module: nablarch-common-auth.

Top-level handlers index page. Should remain as general handler category without specific pattern assignment.
Standalone handlers index page. All standalone handlers are for batch applications, so should include batch-nablarch category.
Common handlers index page. Contains handlers used across multiple patterns (batch, REST, web), so should remain generic.
